intro: Urostachys lechleri var. lehmannii, commonly known as the Amazonian rubber tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. The plant is notable for its latex-producing properties, which have been historically used in the production of natural rubber. Its leaves are typically alternate and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture and a dark green color. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
